Nashville — Shownotes S01E01

By:
Mailed on: October 11, 2012

Dear , ,

Dear Cast and Crew of Nashville, S01E01 – “Pilot”

Original air date:
October 10, 2012

Episode synopsis:
Fading country superstar Rayna James is forced to team up with teen sensation Juliette Barnes or face the loss of her tour and promotion of her latest records. Rayna’s father, Lamar, disregards her wishes when he backs her husband in a run for mayor of Nashville.

Shownotes:

  •  Give casting director Jeanie Bacharach a raise – amazing job.  (CR)
  •  Is this music on iTunes yet? Okay, good. (CR)
  •  Don’t let T-Bone Burnett divorce series creator Callie Khouri or the show’s in trouble (CR)
  •  The Juliette Barnes character is not inspired by Taylor Swift. Nope, not at all. (CR)
  •  More of those rich, gravel throat threats from Powers Booth please! (CR)
  •  So many characters, and already so well developed. (CR)
  •  No melodramatic outbust when Deacon tells Rayna he might join Juliette’s tour? I could get used to  this. (CR)
  •  The husband’s name is Teddy, and he’s cute like a Teddy bear. #nailedit (CR)
  •  Sam Palladio’s falsetto during If I Didn’t Know Better just made my nipples hard (CR)
  •  It took the final song in Glee’s pilot (Journey’s “Don’t Stop Believing”) to save the show. The final song in Nashville (an original) is just icing on the cake. (CR)
  • If this show ends up going off a cliff, it better be just like Khouri’s own Thelma & Louise

Signed,

Christopher Redmond (CR)

Status: (/5)

The Master | Here Comes the Boom
